home.sprintDescription: Sprints are intensive development session on an open source project of your choice, in a team environment. It's a time to come together with colleagues, old and new, to share what you've learned and apply it to an open source project. Is this your first time joining in Sprints? No problem! It will be the time that you learn directly from the open source contributors. Sprint sessions are not just limited to the projects using Python, all languages are welcome!
home.tutorialDescription: Tutorials are educational programs for beginners, or challengers for new era. Tutorial mentors and tutors will guide you to easy way of learning. We recommend tutorials for beginner programmers or Python strangers.
home.conferenceDescription: There are over 50 different presentation sessions that share knowledge and use of Python use cases. In addition, various events such as sponsored company booth, young coder, lightning talk, open space are available. You can participate in the event and interact with various participants.

sponsor.title: PyCon Korea 2019 Sponsor
sponsor.description: Thanks to the support of sponsors who are sympathetic to the importance of open source and the Python community, PyCon Korea has held an event where more developers can participate, such as video recording and financial support. We are looking for sponsors who are interested in supporting the growth of the Python community through sponsorship of PyCon Korea and interested in having special value as an official sponsor of PyCon Korea 2019.

home.pyconKoreaDescription: PyCon is a non-commercial conference held by Python Programming Communities over the world. PyCon Korea has been successfully hold in several years with a group of volunteers called ‚ÄòPyCon Korea Preparation Organizers‚Äô, who support the local Korean Python community.
home.sloganDescription1: The slogan of PyCon Korea 2019 is "Connect the Pythonistas".
home.sloganDescription2: PyCon Korea is a meeting point for Python users, and is also a contact point with other languages and communities. At PyCon Korea, you can meet a person who has studied a field in-depth, meet pythonistas in a completely different field, or meet a close friend.
home.sloganDescription3: We hope that, through the Pycon Korea, a lot of directions and fields are scattered so that the pian stars, who exist in different points, will gather together to become beautiful constellations. See you in PyCon Korea 2019.

differenceWithOthers.title: What's the difference between PyCon and other developer's conferences?
differenceWithOthers.description: PyCon Korea is a non-profitable, developer-oriented event organized by community members, and has different characteristics from conferences organized companies or organizations. All attendees, including speakers, tutorial hosts, voluntary workers, and organizers, participate in PyCon Korea without any profitable purpose, and only to broaden the usage of Python, an open source programming language, and activate its community.

overview.title: Various ways to contribute to PyCon Korea
overview.intro: You can contribute to PyCon Korea in various ways including keynote, speeker, tutorial, sprint, volunteer and lightning talk. We will recruit each item with the following schedule.

cfpGuide.title: How to submit proposal
cfpGuide.intro: This page has written to provide detailed information for speakers of PyCon Korea. Below information and suggestion will guide your presentation to be more informative and persuasive to audience in PyCon Korea.

notice.title: Guide for Speeker

record.title: Session recording
record.content: All session of PyCon Korea will be recorded and open to public after conference. Please consider this before you submit your proposal.

pays.title: Everybody Pays
pays.content: PyCon is Python community's voluntary event. Please understand we are not able to provide all the material expense supports (pay, expenses, free tickets) to our speakers. Regards on this matter, please visit page explains about PyCon‚Äôs main value and philosophy "Everybody Pays" .

vote.title: Voting preference
vote.content: Also, first screened proposal will be voted by early bird ticket holders. The purpose of this vote is to find out preference and interest of sessions and rate those voted proposals. Program team will select final speakers based on preference vote to make this event more fun and enjoyable to as many audience as possible.

communication.title: Continuing communication
communication.content: For the last, please understand the moment you submit your proposal and till it get selected, there will be continuing communication with program team. We recommend you to submit your proposal earlier before its deadline to communicate with program team to build your talk session more fun and informative.

notice.conclusion: If you‚Äôre all familiar with guidance now, are you ready to start your proposal?

beforeProposal.title: Before you start to fill your proposal

consider.description: There are a few things to consider before working on proposal.
consider.item1: What is your main topic? What would you like to talk about?
consider.item3: What can your audience get from your talk?
consider.item4: How would you manage time in your session?

information.description: Also, below information must be included in your proposal.
information.item4: Note or Question (Only PyCon program team can view this section, so feel free to write in any form)
information.conclusion: Only title, summary, details, target audience, time slot, and language will open to early bird holders during preference vote.

beforeProposal.conclusion: Do you feel a little bit pressured with all these criteria? Don't worry! Real guidance is now here. We'll help you with detail information to work on your proposal.

selectTopic.title: Select topic
selectTopic.description: The best way to select topic is to review topics from previous PyCon event. Not only look for topic, but also get the reference from presentation slides will help you start. Choose interesting topic for audience!
selectTopic.conclusion: Once you decide your topic, now you can start thinking about what should be on your proposal in detailed level. Check below information for help.

proposalType.title: Good proposal vs Not good proposal

good.title: Good proposal üëç
good.item1: Include below information on your summary/details section.
good.item1-1: What kind of background does audience need to understand this talk?
good.item1-2: What will audience gain after attend this talk?
good.item2: Write presentation flow and estimate time of your talk.
good.item3: If your topic is not familiar to most of Python users, Please include blog address, wiki, source code to help understand topic.

bad.title: Not good proposal üôÖ‚ÄçÔ∏è
bad.item1: Please avoid deliver only simple information such as how to use or advertise your(or your company's) products. However, If you have case at company where you solve programming issue or open source project that helps to audience is more then welcome.
bad.item2: Proposal should be completed and detailed. Incomplete proposal is not acceptable.
